verses.esv: 15 When he returned, having received the kingdom, he ordered these servants to whom he had given the money to be called to him, that he might know what they had gained by doing business.
verses.kjv: 15 And it came to pass, that when he was returned, having received the kingdom, then he commanded these servants to be called unto him, to whom he had given the money, that he might know how much every man had gained by trading.
verses.niv: 15 "He was made king, however, and returned home. Then he sent for the servants to whom he had given the money, in order to find out what they had gained with it.

verses.esv: 9 Have I not commanded you? Be strong and courageous. Do not be frightened, and do not be dismayed, for the LORD your God is with you wherever you go.”
verses.kjv: 9 Have not I commanded thee? Be strong and of a good courage; be not afraid, neither be thou dismayed: for the LORD thy God is with thee whithersoever thou goest.
verses.niv: 9 Have I not commanded you? Be strong and courageous. Do not be terrified; do not be discouraged, for the LORD your God will be with you wherever you go."

verses.esv: 15 for I will give you a mouth and wisdom, which none of your adversaries will be able to withstand or contradict.
verses.kjv: 15 For I will give you a mouth and wisdom, which all your adversaries shall not be able to gainsay nor resist.
verses.niv: 15 For I will give you words and wisdom that none of your adversaries will be able to resist or contradict.

verses.esv: 31 And as you wish that others would do to you, do so to them.
verses.kjv: 31 And as ye would that men should do to you, do ye also to them likewise.
verses.niv: 31 Do to others as you would have them do to you.

verses.esv: 2 Do not be conformed to this world, but be transformed by the renewal of your mind, that by testing you may discern what is the will of God, what is good and acceptable and perfect.
verses.kjv: 2 And be not conformed to this world: but be ye transformed by the renewing of your mind, that ye may prove what is that good, and acceptable, and perfect, will of God.
verses.niv: 2 Do not conform any longer to the pattern of this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind. Then you will be able to test and approve what God's will is--his good, pleasing and perfect will.

verses.esv: 23 Whatever you do, work heartily, as for the Lord and not for men,
verses.kjv: 23 And whatsoever ye do, do it heartily, as to the Lord, and not unto men;
verses.niv: 23 Whatever you do, work at it with all your heart, as working for the Lord, not for men,

verses.esv: 5 If any of you lacks wisdom, let him ask God, who gives generously to all without reproach, and it will be given him.
verses.kjv: 5 If any of you lack wisdom, let him ask of God, that giveth to all men liberally, and upbraideth not; and it shall be given him.
verses.niv: 5 If any of you lacks wisdom, he should ask God, who gives generously to all without finding fault, and it will be given to him.

verses.esv: 11 For I know the plans I have for you, declares the LORD, plans for welfare and not for evil, to give you a future and a hope.
verses.kjv: 11 For I know the thoughts that I think toward you, saith the LORD, thoughts of peace, and not of evil, to give you an expected end.
verses.niv: 11 For I know the plans I have for you," declares the LORD, "plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future.

verses.esv: 5 For we never came with words of flattery, as you know, nor with a pretext for greed—God is witness.
verses.kjv: 5 For neither at any time used we flattering words, as ye know, nor a cloke of covetousness; God is witness:
verses.niv: 5 You know we never used flattery, nor did we put on a mask to cover up greed--God is our witness.

verses.esv: 17 And whatever you do, in word or deed, do everything in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father through him.
verses.kjv: 17 And whatsoever ye do in word or deed, do all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God and the Father by him.
verses.niv: 17 And whatever you do, whether in word or deed, do it all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father through him.

verses.esv: 35 In all things I have shown you that by working hard in this way we must help the weak and remember the words of the Lord Jesus, how he himself said, ‘It is more blessed to give than to receive.’”
verses.kjv: 35 I have shewed you all things, how that so labouring ye ought to support the weak, and to remember the words of the Lord Jesus, how he said, It is more blessed to give than to receive.
verses.niv: 35 In everything I did, I showed you that by this kind of hard work we must help the weak, remembering the words the Lord Jesus himself said: 'It is more blessed to give than to receive.'"

verses.esv: 33 I have said these things to you, that in me you may have peace. In the world you will have tribulation. But take heart; I have overcome the world.”
verses.kjv: 33 These things I have spoken unto you, that in me ye might have peace. In the world ye shall have tribulation: but be of good cheer; I have overcome the world.
verses.niv: 33 "I have told you these things, so that in me you may have peace. In this world you will have trouble. But take heart! I have overcome the world."

verses.esv:
3   Commit your work to the LORD,
    and your plans will be established.
verses.kjv: 3 Commit thy works unto the LORD, and thy thoughts shall be established.
verses.niv: 3 Commit to the LORD whatever you do, and your plans will succeed.

verses.esv:
11   Wealth gained hastily will dwindle,
    but whoever gathers little by little will increase it.
verses.kjv: 11 Wealth gotten by vanity shall be diminished: but he that gathereth by labour shall increase.
verses.niv: 11 Dishonest money dwindles away, but he who gathers money little by little makes it grow.

verses.esv: 18 You shall remember the LORD your God, for it is he who gives you power to get wealth, that he may confirm his covenant that he swore to your fathers, as it is this day.
verses.kjv: 18 But thou shalt remember the LORD thy God: for it is he that giveth thee power to get wealth, that he may establish his covenant which he sware unto thy fathers, as it is this day.
verses.niv: 18 But remember the LORD your God, for it is he who gives you the ability to produce wealth, and so confirms his covenant, which he swore to your forefathers, as it is today.

verses.esv: 16 All Scripture is breathed out by God and profitable for teaching, for reproof, for correction, and for training in righteousness,
verses.kjv: 16 All scripture is given by inspiration of God, and is profitable for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in righteousness:
verses.niv: 16 All Scripture is God-breathed and is useful for teaching, rebuking, correcting and training in righteousness,

verses.esv: 7 for God gave us a spirit not of fear but of power and love and self-control.
verses.kjv: 7 For God hath not given us the spirit of fear; but of power, and of love, and of a sound mind.
verses.niv: 7 For God did not give us a spirit of timidity, but a spirit of power, of love and of self-discipline.

verses.esv: 13 I can do all things through him who strengthens me.
verses.kjv: 13 I can do all things through Christ which strengtheneth me.
verses.niv: 13 I can do everything through him who gives me strength.

verses.esv: 29 Let no corrupting talk come out of your mouths, but only such as is good for building up, as fits the occasion, that it may give grace to those who hear.
verses.kjv: 29 Let no corrupt communication proceed out of your mouth, but that which is good to the use of edifying, that it may minister grace unto the hearers.
verses.niv: 29 Do not let any unwholesome talk come out of your mouths, but only what is helpful for building others up according to their needs, that it may benefit those who listen.

verses.esv: 37 For nothing will be impossible with God.”
verses.kjv: 37 For with God nothing shall be impossible.
verses.niv: 37 For nothing is impossible with God."

verses.esv: 19 Go therefore and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, 20 teaching them to observe all that I have commanded you. And behold, I am with you always, to the end of the age.”
verses.kjv: 19 Go ye therefore, and teach all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Ghost: 20 Teaching them to observe all things whatsoever I have commanded you: and, lo, I am with you alway, even unto the end of the world. Amen.
verses.niv: 19 Therefore go and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, 20 and teaching them to obey everything I have commanded you. And surely I am with you always, to the very end of the age."

verses.esv:
9   The heart is deceitful above all things,
    and desperately sick;
    who can understand it?
verses.kjv: 9 The heart is deceitful above all things, and desperately wicked: who can know it?
verses.niv: 9 The heart is deceitful above all things and beyond cure. Who can understand it?

verses.esv:
8   Better is a little with righteousness
    than great revenues with injustice.
verses.kjv: 8 Better is a little with righteousness than great revenues without right.
verses.niv: 8 Better a little with righteousness than much gain with injustice.

verses.esv:
5   Trust in the LORD with all your heart,
    and do not lean on your own understanding.
6   In all your ways acknowledge him,
    and he will make straight your paths.
verses.kjv: 5 Trust in the LORD with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding. 6 In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths.
verses.niv: 5 Trust in the LORD with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; 6 in all your ways acknowledge him, and he will make your paths straight.

verses.esv: 13 “You shall not oppress your neighbor or rob him. The wages of a hired worker shall not remain with you all night until the morning.
verses.kjv: 13 Thou shalt not defraud thy neighbour, neither rob him: the wages of him that is hired shall not abide with thee all night until the morning.
verses.niv: 13 "'Do not defraud your neighbor or rob him. "'Do not hold back the wages of a hired man overnight.
